# UIBarPosition.top

**Case**

Specifies that the bar is at the top of its containing view.

## Declaration

```swift
case top
```

## Discussion

The system uses this as a hint to draw directional decoration accordingly. For example, any shadow would be drawn below the bar.

Instances of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIToolbar] do not appear with this position on iPhone, but they can on iPad.

## Constants

- **UIBarPosition.any**: Specifies that the position is unspecified.
- **UIBarPosition.bottom**: Specifies that the bar is at the bottom of its containing view.
- **UIBarPosition.topAttached**: Specifies that the bar is at the top of the screen, as well as its containing view.
